body:
I can confirm this fixes the looping issue.

it still overwrites the ResultSet Obect... ? i guess the intend is to make it more readable?
but could this not lead to unexpected behaviour?

> it still overwrites the ResultSet Obect... ?

It doesn't overwrite the ResultSet object. `__debugInfo()` just modifies the info sent to PHP's debug functions.

The problem here was `toArray()` moves the pointer to the end of the collection, that's why you always got only the 1st item. Resetting the internal pointer each time the method is called allows the iteration to continue normally.

issue.title: Fix issue iterating ResultSet with xdebug breakpoints.

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Closes #18234

body:
But isn't the reason for a loopable resultSet so sql->fetch can be called on single iterations and toArray() forces a fetchAll().
That would change the behaviour?

The reason why I don't call ->toArray() directly on the query is because I get VERY MANY results.
If toArray() is in the debugInfo, won't you run into a memory problem when debugging ?

> If toArray() is in the debugInfo, won't you run into a memory problem when debugging ?

It could, but that's required to show all the items when doing `debug($resultset)`. So if you are hitting the memory limit then you should fetch only a limited number of records when debugging.

I'd argue, if I want to see all items, I can just write debug($resultset->toArray()).
Having to change my code for debugging is a bad solution.

As I initially said. Debugging should never alter the behavior of the code. Thats a big **no** in programming world.

> Debugging should never alter the behavior of the code. Thats a big no in programming world.

There's no alteration of code behavior. Additional memory is required *only* when using the debugging function. If the additional memory usage is an issue for you then you shouldn't be using Xdebug either, since just enabling it increases memory usage.

it's true that xdebug increases ram uses by maybe 20%. that's just unavoidable. if they had a magical way to debug without using aditional ram, they would do it.

I just don't see the advantage of that additional info that you add to the ResultSet. 
It seems to me like just a conviniance, so the user does not have to call toArray himself.
The downside is, that you introduce a possibly huge amount of additional RAM, not just a fixed 20%, but an unknown factor. that could very well be 2000% or more, depending on the query.
Is that worth it?

If I have one item of my eg. 2 million entries that has an issue, how am I supposed to find it, if I cant set a debug condition and loop them all? This 'extra' feature prevents me from doing that.
You can open a separate RFC for modifying the behavior of `ResultSet::__debugInfo()`. The iteration problem initially reported has been addressed.

issue.title: ResultSet debugInfo

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
### Description

```
$rs = $this->find()->all();    // ResultSet
```
If you expect the response of a query to be big, you would work with a Query or ResultSet Object, rather than calling ->toArray() to avoid memory issues.

Currenlty, if you enable the debugger, the ResultSet __debugInfo is calling ->toArray anyways.
In the worstcase, it now tries to load 2 million entries from your DB and may lead to an out of memory issue.
So the whole meaning of using the ResultSet in the first place gets lost.

I suggest removing that additional debugging info from the ResultSet.

(issue initially came up in #18234 )

### CakePHP Version

5.1.6
